intro: Campanula rapunculoides var. megastachya, commonly known as the giant bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It features upright stems that can grow up to 2 meters tall, crowned with large, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. This variety is noted for its showy blooms and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
